about_the_game:
Welcome to Hope
Everyone here wears the same outfit, lives the same repetitive routine, and is “happy”!



One day, you wake up in a smiley headset to yourself in Hope. Although there are routine classes and odd assessments, everyone lives a uniform, content and carefree life. This is until a foggy memory starts flickering in your mind; as a mysterious girl keeps intruding your thoughts, an absurd history begins to unfold itself…

Be prepared for a story-rich adventure in Name of The Will!



  • Set in a surreptitious and futuristic world resembling Hong Kong
  • Colorful hand-drawn 2D side-scroller where you can walk, run, jump, crawl, grab and climb in
  • Countless challenging puzzles, dilemmas and tough decisions present themselves through your journey
  • Dodge the secretive governors and interact with your neighbors to complete missions
  • Your choices and actions will decide your neighbors' and your fate
  • Original soundtracks fused with electrical soundscape and foley to establish an atmospheric vibe

content_descriptors.notes: This game contains depictions of suicide and may not be suitable for all audiences.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04/CentOS 7
  • Processor: x64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support
  • Memory: 3 GB RAM
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Gnome desktop environment running on top of X11 windowing system. Other configuration and user environment as provided stock with the supported distribution (such as Kernel or Compositor). Nvidia and AMD GPUs using Nvidia official proprietary graphics driver or AMD Mesa graphics driver.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: OS X 10.13
  • Processor: Apple Silicon (64-bit)
  • Memory: 3 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Metal capable Intel and AMD GPUs
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: You are informed to be a resident of Hope, a suspiciously harmonious community. Dodge the secretive governors, establish a rapport with your neighbors who monitor you, and solve puzzles to find out how you got here. Are you willing to sacrifice for the truth? Or, are you choosing a life of oblivion?
